page.title: 07Woodlands of Beeley Moor
page.content: There are four main plantations in the area. These are managed in conjunction with the{Forestry Commission}agents on a commercial basis and all provide game coverts for pheasant and grouse. The two plantations north of the Hipper valley have been recently planted and contain deciduous and coniferous trees. The main trees there are Norway Spruce, Scots Pine, rowan, oak, silver birch, beech and sycamore. The spruce and pine form the major proportion and therefore these plantations are dominantly coniferous. The north west corner of the area contains one plantation comprised mainly of larch, Corsican Pine, and silver birch which have been recently planted in one area of the plantation. The South of the area supports one coniferous plantation with the Norway Spruce being the dominant tree.
